title.narrative: OUTPUT 27: M&E AND DATA SYSTEMS

description.narrative: National M&E and data systems are strengthened so as to increasingly support evidence-based policies and programmes, which contributes to Communication And Advocacy, Cross-Sectoral - Human Rights, Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas, Cross-Sectoral - Planning And Programme Reviews, Evaluation, Operations Support To Programme Delivery, Research. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, poor children benefit from inclusive development being a central objective of national and sectoral policies

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: National M&E and data systems are strengthened so as to increasingly support evidence-based policies and programmes

description.narrative: National capacity for M&E was enhanced through the UNICEF-suported launch of Mid-term evaluation of the 2018-2021 medium term policy frameowrk;;the conduct and dissemination of research on impact of COVID-19 on children; and building capacity for tracking and monitoring the SDGs and child rights.; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:05/01/2022
